content.description:
The route climbs a nice crack system on the prow.

Pitch 1- Begin at the flare located about 6 feet off the ground.  Continue up the crack system on the prow to an anchor of drilled angles at 140 feet.

Pitch 2- Climb the flaring crack system and chimney to an anchor of two drilled angles.  160 feet.
content.protection: A full selection of clean aid climbing gear.  2-3 sets of cams from small to large.  Stoppers, etc...
content.location: This route is located right up the main prow facing the road.

content.description: A nice pitch with a lot of variety in different styles of crack climbing. Scramble up to the ledge. Start with the low angle crack, climb or stem past the wide section, enjoy twin cracks and stemming to a 2 bolt anchor

climbs.name: Street Legal
climbs.fa: Mike Friedrichs, Mary Ellen Gage, Gene Roush, 1990.

content.description: Thin fingers climbing in a clean right facing corner.
content.protection: Lots of small gear.  Green aliens work nice in a few spots.
content.location: 25 feet left of BBQ Bomber in the alcove facing BHW road.

content.description: This is the right facing dihedral. It's a clean climb and worth it if you're over here. two bolt anchor can be seen from the ground.
content.protection: don't remember exactly but you can see the entire route so the gear is pretty obvious

content.description: This is the lower angle thin crack that arches left forming a J shape. The anchors are on the left side of the crack visible from the ground. Crack is thin but there are good feet most of the way.
Climb up an awkward section with a hand crack on the right in the main crack. Then get up under the small roof. Pull the small roof on good hands, the chains are about 10 more feet.
content.protection: the roof takes 2's and you can get 1 deeper under the roof but don't get it stuck
content.location: There is a small tree right at the base of it. See the photo. Anchors are visible from the ground.

content.description: A 5 would be nice. Some may like the 6.

Climb a nice handcrack in the cave formed by a large boulder leaning against the wall.  At the top of the handcrack, climb a roof/bombay chimney to the lip then over the lip to a double bolt anchor above.
content.protection: A set of cams, including larger sizes. (Rope drag can be a problem above the lip.)
content.location: This route is located behind a large boulder leaning against the wall just left of Ladies of the 80's.

content.description:
Layback up a clean left facing corner (1.5 friends) to the roof.  Stem out the roof and pull tricky moves into ofwidth crack above the roof.  Climb up the now right facing corn above to another roof passed on the left and finish in the final corner with fingers (yellow TCU).

Rivals BBQ Bomber and Citizen Cane for best 5.11 in the Swell.  Rarely climbed, despite its proximity to the road.
content.protection: Good amount of 1.5 friends, with quite a few thin hands pieces and cups pieces.  At least one wide piece is nice above the crux (#5 friend).  New rap bolts make for a smooth double rope rap. couple of OW pieces are nice
content.location: Left of the aid lines (e.g. Vertical Smile).  Find this route and Street Legal in a cool alcove with a huge leaning block on the right.  Park as for Private Pizza and traverse up and left to the route.
Starts left of off width and shares anchors.
